revised_title: The Importance of Vapour Pressure in Muscle Metabolism
tldr: The authors discovered that the phenomenon of increased heat production in muscles after anaerobic stimulation is due to a change in vapour pressure caused by an increase in dissolved molecules. This finding led to the development of a new method for measuring molecular concentrations and understanding the role of vapour pressure in muscle metabolism.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
